article_title: Photos: Colleges Work to Blend Technology With Teacher Training
article_text:
x of x Students in Corey Gilman's second-grade class use a mix of old-school and new technologies in the classroom. Peggy Barmore

x of x Corey Gilman wrote a grant to get a single iPod he uses to help students with their reading skills. Peggy Barmore

x of x Matt Stuve, left, shows 2014 Indiana Teacher of the Year Steven Perkins the latest in tablets for educators. Perkins attended Ball State's Best Practices in Education Conference in May. Peggy Barmore

x of x Technology courses are state-mandated for special education majors like Christine Leimberger, who says technology is integral to developing individual education plans in special ed. Peggy Barmore

x of x Matt Stuve tries out the latest in smart televisions from Apple in one of five innovative smart classrooms at Ball State. Peggy Barmore

x of x Reading is fundamental for students in Corey Gilman’s class. Peggy Barmore
